title: Shortcuts
content:
Navigation shortcuts

  • cd -: previous directory
  • pushd/popd: directory stack (shell-dependent)
cd ~/unix-cli-practice
mkdir -p stack/a stack/b
pushd stack/a
pushd ../b
dirs
popd
popd

Line editing shortcuts

  • Ctrl+A: start of line
  • Ctrl+E: end of line
  • Alt+B/Alt+F: move by word (terminal-dependent)

Practice

Use Ctrl+A/Ctrl+E while editing a long command. Use cd - repeatedly when switching between two folders.
